newsitem.title: USA: GATX General American unit Q3 profit up.
newsitem.headline: GATX General American unit Q3 profit up.

text.p: GATX Corp said its General American Transportation Corp unit had third quarter earnings of $17.8 million, up from $15.6 million a year ago, reflecting both new car additions and fleet acquisitions.
Domestic fleet utilization was 95 percent at the end of the quarter, the same level as a year ago, but one percent higher than the previous quarter.
The number of U.S. railcars on lease was 63,400 versus 60,900 at the end of last year's third quarter.
GATX Terminals earned $2.0 million in the current quarter, down from $8.2 million for the third quarter of 1995.
This reflects the continuing weak market for the storage of petroleum products in the United States and expenses related to rationalization initiatives and market and organization evaluation studies.
Utilization at the end of the quarter was 84 percent compared to 87 percent a year ago.
GATX Capital reported earnings of $19.1 million for the third quarter, up from earnings of $7.6 million a year ago.

American Steamship Co earned $2.6 million for the 1996 third quarter compared to earnings of $2.9 million a year ago. Although tonnage demand remains strong on the Great Lakes, earnings were reduced because two vessels were temporarily out of service during the quarter.

GATX Logistics reported earnings of $100,000 for this year's third quarter compared to earnings of $200,000 million for the third quarter of last year. The company said empty space, elimination of short-term contracts and customer attrition reduced earnings for the quarter.
Earlier, GATX reported third quarter earnings of $1.47 a primary share, up from $1.13 a year ago.
Cash flow from operations and portfolio proceeds were $260 million in the third quarter, up from $95 million a year ago.
